question:
Which of the following are sub-schemes under the National Social Assistance Programme (NSAP)?
  1. National Family Benefit Scheme (NFBS)
  2. Annapurna Scheme
  3. Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA)
Select the correct option from codes given below:
explanation: The NSAP comprises of five sub-schemes namely Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme (IGNOAPS), Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme (IGNWPS), Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme (IGNDPS), National Family Benefit Scheme (NFBS) and Annapurna Scheme. The schemes of NSAP are implemented both in urban and rural areas, by the Social Welfare Department in the States. Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) is not a sub-scheme under the National Social Assistance Programme (NSAP).
